Offtopic: Dont say “Paying $1 to somebody that can help :D” Rule 10: We do not sell anything on this site with the exception of SCAR scripts. SCAR Scripts must be verified, check the script sales board for more info.

item.title: Paying $1 to somebody that can help :D
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

nicke924:

Try to run “RunServer.bat”?

It is linux, so of course the batch file wont work.

You’re going to have to change the directories of the config files to be safe. (Instead of using ‘’ you have to use ‘/’)

And for the second part, explain nulling?

Read full topic

item.title: Paying $1 to somebody that can help :D
item.dc:creator: @davidscherman davidscherman
item.description:
@davidscherman wrote:

Im running my server on a newly bought CentOS 5 vps from hostgator.com (1 cent vps ftw…) I got everything installed my run.sh is

#!/bin/bash
java server &
read
Everytime i run it off terminal none of the cfg’s are found. Everytime i run off wineconsole cmd i run the .bat, but the server nulls. Now the question is. How can i fix either one of them. I know the first problem is the directorys where *.cfg is found is diffrent. How can i change this. If i can get my server working without nulling and the .cfg’s are loading i will pay $1 (Huge sum of cash eh.?) Thanks in advance

~David

Read full topic
item.source: Paying $1 to somebody that can help :D
